marathon_runners.name: Eliud Kipchoge
marathon_runners.notable_fact: First human to run a marathon in under 2 hours in controlled conditions (1:59:40)

marathon_runners.name: Haile Gebrselassie
marathon_runners.notable_fact: Known for his world records in long-distance track events and his prolific marathon career

marathon_runners.name: Kenenisa Bekele
marathon_runners.notable_fact: Former world record holder in the 5,000m and 10,000m, close to breaking Kipchoge's marathon record

marathon_runners.name: Dennis Kimetto
marathon_runners.notable_fact: Former world record holder, first athlete to run under 2 hours and 3 minutes in a marathon

marathon_runners.name: Wilson Kipsang
marathon_runners.notable_fact: Former world record holder and two-time London Marathon winner

marathon_runners.name: Paula Radcliffe
marathon_runners.notable_fact: Held the women's marathon world record for more than 16 years

marathon_runners.name: Brigid Kosgei
marathon_runners.notable_fact: Current women's marathon world record holder

marathon_runners.name: Tsegaye Kebede
marathon_runners.notable_fact: Olympic marathon medalist and two-time London Marathon winner

marathon_runners.name: Samuel Wanjiru
marathon_runners.notable_fact: 2008 Olympic gold medalist, the first Kenyan to win this title

marathon_runners.name: Meb Keflezighi
marathon_runners.notable_fact: First American to win the Boston Marathon since 1983
